wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Maurice Grove Taylor  (1881–1960) was a British Army officer.

response: Taylor was born near Balloch, Scotland to English parents; the son of Maurice Grove Taylor. He was educated at Oundle Public school and passed the entrance exam to King's College, Cambridge, where he studied for a year before moving to Manchester University.
* Lieutenant-General Maurice Grove Taylor, , late Royal Engineers, Deputy Master-General of the Ordnance, The War Office.
*Major-General Maurice Grove Taylor  (late Royal Engineers). Formerly Commander, 166th (South Lancashire and Cheshire) Infantry Brigade, now Half Pay List.
*Major and Brevet Lieutenant-Colonel Maurice Grove Taylor  Royal Engineers
*Major and Brevet Lieutenant-Colonel Maurice Grove Taylor  Royal Engineers
